intro: Bouchea pseudogervao f. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy pseudogervao, is a unique variant of the pseudogervao plant, characterized by its dense, fuzzy foliage. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is native to the arid regions of South America. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in a composite head, and bloom in late spring to early summer. This ornamental plant is often cultivated for its striking foliage and adaptability to dry conditions.
